info.title: Box Platform API
info.description: [Box Platform](https://box.dev) provides functionality to provide access to content stored within [Box](https://box.com). It provides endpoints for basic manipulation of files and folders, management of users within an enterprise, as well as more complex topics such as legal holds and retention policies.

post.description: Marks a file as a Box Doc Gen template.

requestBody.description: Marks the provided file as a Box Doc Gen template.

201.description: The file which has now been marked as a Box Doc Gen template.

400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error.

403.description: The client does not have access rights to the content or resource requested.

429.description: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

default.description: An unexpected condition was encountered on the server.

get.description: Lists Box Doc Gen templates on which the user is a collaborator.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description:
Defines the position marker at which to begin returning results. This is
used when paginating using marker-based pagination.

This requires `usemarker` to be set to `true`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

200.description: Returns a collection of templates.

400.description: Returned if the user has passed in a malformed marker or limit value.

401.description:
Returned when the access token provided in the `Authorization` header
is not recognized or not provided.

delete.description: Unmarks file as Box Doc Gen template.

parameters.name: template_id
parameters.description: ID of the file which will no longer be marked as a Box Doc Gen template.

204.description: Returns an empty response when a file is no longer marked as a Box Doc Gen template.

400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error.

403.description: The client does not have access rights to the content or resource requested.

404.description:
Returned if the template is not found or the user does not
have access to the associated template.

429.description: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

default.description: An unexpected condition was encountered on the server.

get.summary: Get Box Doc Gen template by ID
get.description: Lists details of a specific Box Doc Gen template.

parameters.name: template_id
parameters.description: The ID of a Box Doc Gen template.

200.description: Returns a template.

401.description:
Returned when the access token provided in the `Authorization` header
is not recognized or not provided.

404.description:
Returned if the template is not found or the user does not
have access to the associated template.

get.summary: List all Box Doc Gen template tags in template
get.description: Lists all tags in a Box Doc Gen template.

parameters.name: template_id
parameters.description: ID of template.

parameters.name: template_version_id
parameters.description: Id of template version.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description:
Defines the position marker at which to begin returning results. This is
used when paginating using marker-based pagination.

This requires `usemarker` to be set to `true`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

200.description: A list of document generation template tags.

400.description: Returned if the user has passed in a malformed marker or limit value.

403.description: The client does not have access rights to the content or resource requested.

404.description: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future.

429.description: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

default.description: An unexpected condition was encountered on the server.

get.summary: Get Box Doc Gen job by ID
get.description: Get details of the Box Doc Gen job.

parameters.name: job_id
parameters.description: Box Doc Gen job ID.

200.description: Details of the Box Doc Gen job.

403.description: The client does not have access rights to the content or resource requested.

404.description:
Returned if the job is not found or the user does not
have access to the associated job.

429.description: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

default.description: An unexpected condition was encountered on the server.

get.summary: List all Box Doc Gen jobs
get.description: Lists all Box Doc Gen jobs for a user.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description:
Defines the position marker at which to begin returning results. This is
used when paginating using marker-based pagination.

This requires `usemarker` to be set to `true`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

400.description: Returned if the user has passed in a malformed marker or limit value.

403.description: The client does not have access rights to the content or resource requested.

429.description: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

default.description: An unexpected condition was encountered on the server.

get.summary: Get list of all Box Doc Gen jobs for template
get.description: Lists the users jobs which use this template.

parameters.name: template_id
parameters.description: Id of template to fetch jobs for.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description:
Defines the position marker at which to begin returning results. This is
used when paginating using marker-based pagination.

This requires `usemarker` to be set to `true`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

200.description: A single Box Doc Gen template.

400.description: Returned if the user has passed in a malformed marker or limit value.

403.description: The client does not have access rights to the content or resource requested.

404.description:
Returned if the template is not found or the user does not
have access to the associated template.

429.description: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

default.description: An unexpected condition was encountered on the server.

get.summary: Get Box Doc Gen jobs by batch ID
get.description: Lists Box Doc Gen jobs in a batch.

parameters.name: batch_id
parameters.description: Box Doc Gen batch ID.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description:
Defines the position marker at which to begin returning results. This is
used when paginating using marker-based pagination.

This requires `usemarker` to be set to `true`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

200.description: Returns a list of Box Doc Gen jobs in a Box Doc Gen batch.

400.description: Returned if the user has passed in a malformed marker or limit value.

403.description: The client does not have access rights to the content or resource requested.

404.description:
Returned if the batch is not found or the user does not
have access to the associated batch.

429.description: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

default.description: An unexpected condition was encountered on the server.

post.summary: Generate document using Box Doc Gen template
post.description: Generates a document using a Box Doc Gen template.

403.description: The client does not have access rights to the content or resource requested.

429.description: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

default.description: An unexpected condition was encountered on the server.

get.description: Retrieves the configuration for an enterprise.

parameters.name: enterprise_id
parameters.description: The ID of the enterprise.

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of the enterprise configuration categories.
Allowed values: `security`, `content_and_sharing`, `user_settings`, `shield`.

200.description: Returns the enterprise configuration.

get.description: Retrieves all Box Hubs for requesting user.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query string to search for Box Hubs.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
The scope of the Box Hubs to retrieve. Possible values include `editable`,
`view_only`, and `all`. Default is `all`.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The field to sort results by. 
Possible values include `name`, `updated_at`,
`last_accessed_at`, `view_count`, and `relevance`.
Default is `relevance`.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description:
The direction to sort results in. This can be either in alphabetical ascending
(`ASC`) or descending (`DESC`) order.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description:
Defines the position marker at which to begin returning results. This is
used when paginating using marker-based pagination.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

200.description: Returns all Box Hubs for the given user or enterprise.

400.description: Returned if any of the request parameters are not valid.

403.description:
Returns an error when the user does not have the
right permissions to create a Hub.

get.summary: List all Box Hubs for requesting enterprise
get.description:
Retrieves all Box Hubs for a given enterprise.

Admins or Hub Co-admins of an enterprise
with GCM scope can make this call.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query string to search for Box Hubs.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The field to sort results by.
Possible values include `name`, `updated_at`,
`last_accessed_at`, `view_count`, and `relevance`.
Default is `relevance`.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description:
The direction to sort results in. This can be either in alphabetical ascending
(`ASC`) or descending (`DESC`) order.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description:
Defines the position marker at which to begin returning results. This is
used when paginating using marker-based pagination.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

200.description: Returns all Box Hubs for the given user or enterprise.

get.summary: Get Box Hub information by ID
get.description: Retrieves details for a Box Hub by its ID.

parameters.name: hub_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier that represent a hub.

The ID for any hub can be determined
by visiting this hub in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the URL `https://*.app.box.com/hubs/123`
the `hub_id` is `123`.

200.description: Returns a hub object.

401.description:
Returned when the access token provided in the `Authorization` header
is not recognized or not provided.

404.description:
Returned if the hub is not found, or the user does not
have access to the hub.

put.summary: Update Box Hub information by ID
put.description: Updates a Box Hub. Can be used to change title, description, or Box Hub settings.

parameters.name: hub_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier that represent a hub.

The ID for any hub can be determined
by visiting this hub in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the URL `https://*.app.box.com/hubs/123`
the `hub_id` is `123`.

200.description: Returns a Hub object.

401.description:
Returned when the access token provided in the `Authorization` header
is not recognized or not provided.

404.description:
Returned if the Hub is not found, or the user does not
have access to the Hub.

parameters.name: hub_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier that represent a hub.

The ID for any hub can be determined
by visiting this hub in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the URL `https://*.app.box.com/hubs/123`
the `hub_id` is `123`.

204.description:
A blank response is returned if the hub was
successfully deleted.

401.description:
Returned when the access token provided in the `Authorization` header
is not recognized or not provided.

404.description:
Returned if the hub is not found or has already been deleted, or the user
does not have access to the hub.

post.description:
Creates a copy of a Box Hub.

The original Box Hub will not be modified.

parameters.name: hub_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier that represent a hub.

The ID for any hub can be determined
by visiting this hub in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the URL `https://*.app.box.com/hubs/123`
the `hub_id` is `123`.

403.description:
Returns an error when the user does not have the
right permissions to create a Hub.

get.description: Retrieves all collaborations for a Box Hub.

parameters.name: hub_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier that represent a hub.

The ID for any hub can be determined
by visiting this hub in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the URL `https://*.app.box.com/hubs/123`
the `hub_id` is `123`.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description:
Defines the position marker at which to begin returning results. This is
used when paginating using marker-based pagination.

This requires `usemarker` to be set to `true`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

200.description: Retrieves the collaborations associated with the specified Box Hub.

401.description:
Returned when the access token provided in the `Authorization` header
is not recognized or not provided.

404.description:
Returned if the Box Hub is not found, or the user does not
have access to the Box Hub.

post.description:
Adds a collaboration for a single user or a single group to a Box Hub.

Collaborations can be created using email address, user IDs, or group IDs.

201.description: Returns a new Box Hub collaboration object.

403.description:
Returns an error when the user does not have the
right permissions to create the collaboration.

get.summary: Get Box Hub collaboration by collaboration ID
get.description: Retrieves details for a Box Hub collaboration by collaboration ID.

parameters.name: hub_collaboration_id
parameters.description: The ID of the hub collaboration.

200.description: Returns a Box Hub collaboration object.

401.description:
Returned when the access token provided in the `Authorization` header
is not recognized or not provided.

404.description:
Returned if the Box Hub is not found, or the user does not
have access to the Box Hub.

put.description:
Updates a Box Hub collaboration.
Can be used to change the Box Hub role.

parameters.name: hub_collaboration_id
parameters.description: The ID of the hub collaboration.

200.description: Returns an updated Box Hub collaboration object.

403.description:
Returns an error if the authenticated user does not have the right
permissions to update the collaboration.

delete.description: Deletes a single Box Hub collaboration.

parameters.name: hub_collaboration_id
parameters.description: The ID of the hub collaboration.

204.description:
A blank response is returned if the Box Hub collaboration was
successfully deleted.

404.description:
Returns an error if the Box Hub collaboration could not be found,
or the authenticated user does not have access to the Box Hub collaboration.

get.description: Retrieves all items associated with a Box Hub.

parameters.name: hub_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier that represent a hub.

The ID for any hub can be determined
by visiting this hub in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the URL `https://*.app.box.com/hubs/123`
the `hub_id` is `123`.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description:
Defines the position marker at which to begin returning results. This is
used when paginating using marker-based pagination.

This requires `usemarker` to be set to `true`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

200.description: Retrieves the items associated with the specified Box Hub.

401.description:
Returned when the access token provided in the `Authorization` header
is not recognized or not provided.

404.description:
Returned if the Box Hub is not found, or the user does not
have access to the Box Hub.

post.description: Adds and/or removes Box Hub items from a Box Hub.

parameters.name: hub_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier that represent a hub.

The ID for any hub can be determined
by visiting this hub in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the URL `https://*.app.box.com/hubs/123`
the `hub_id` is `123`.

207.description: Retrieves the status of all the operations.

401.description:
Returned when the access token provided in the `Authorization` header
is not recognized or not provided.

404.description:
Returned if the Box Hub is not found, or the user does not
have access to the Box Hub.

get.summary: Get all shield lists in enterprise
get.description: Retrieves all shield lists in the enterprise.

200.description: Returns the list of shield list objects.
Returns the shield list object.

409.description: The shield list with this name already exists.

get.summary: Get single shield list by shield list id
get.description: Retrieves a single shield list by its ID.

parameters.name: shield_list_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier that represents a shield list.
The ID for any Shield List can be determined by the response from the endpoint
fetching all shield lists for the enterprise.

200.description: Returns the shield list object.

404.description: The shield list was not found.

delete.summary: Delete single shield list by shield list id
delete.description: Delete a single shield list by its ID.

parameters.name: shield_list_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier that represents a shield list.
The ID for any Shield List can be determined by the response from the endpoint
fetching all shield lists for the enterprise.

204.description: Shield List correctly removed. No content in response.

400.description: The shield list is assigned to some rules and cannot be removed.

404.description: The shield list was not found.

parameters.name: shield_list_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier that represents a shield list.
The ID for any Shield List can be determined by the response from the endpoint
fetching all shield lists for the enterprise.

200.description: Returns the shield list object.

404.description: The shield list was not found.

409.description: The shield list with this name already exists.

get.description:
Retrieves archives for an enterprise.

To learn more about the archive APIs, see the [Archive API Guide](g://archives).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description:
Defines the position marker at which to begin returning results. This is
used when paginating using marker-based pagination.

200.description: Returns a list of archives in the enterprise.

400.description: Returned when some of the parameters are missing or not valid.

401.description:
Returned when the access token provided in the `Authorization` header
is not recognized or not provided.

403.description:
Returned when the authenticated user does not have the right
permissions to list archives.

500.description: Returned when an unexpected server error occurs.

default.description: Returned when an unexpected client error occurs.

post.description:
Creates an archive.

To learn more about the archive APIs, see the [Archive API Guide](g://archives).

description.example: This is an archive for important documents.

storage_policy_id.description: The ID of the storage policy that the archive is assigned to.

400.description: Returned when some of the parameters are missing or not valid.

401.description:
Returned when the access token provided in the `Authorization` header
is not recognized or not provided.

403.description:
Returned when the authenticated user does not have the right
permissions to create an archive.

409.description: Returned when an archive with the given name already exists.

500.description: Returned when an unexpected server error occurs.

default.description: Returned when an unexpected client error occurs.

delete.description:
Permanently deletes an archive.

To learn more about the archive APIs, see the [Archive API Guide](g://archives).

parameters.name: archive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the archive.

204.description: Returns an empty response when the archive has been deleted.

400.description: Returns an error if the archive is not empty.

401.description:
Returned when the access token provided in the `Authorization` header
is not recognized or not provided.

403.description:
Returns an error if the user does not have the right
permissions to delete the archive.

404.description: Returns an error if the archive is not found.

put.description:
Updates an archive.

To learn more about the archive APIs, see the [Archive API Guide](g://archives).

parameters.name: archive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the archive.

description.example: This is an archive for important documents.

200.description: Returns the updated archive object.

400.description: Returned when some of the parameters are not valid.

401.description:
Returned when the access token provided in the `Authorization` header
is not recognized or not provided.

403.description:
Returned when the authenticated user does not have the right
permissions to update the archive.

404.description: Returned when the archive is not found.

409.description: Returned when an archive with the given name already exists.

500.description: Returned when an unexpected server error occurs.

default.description: Returned when an unexpected client error occurs.

post.summary: Submit job to delete external users
post.description:
Delete external users from current user enterprise. This will remove each
external user from all invited collaborations within the current enterprise.

207.description: Multi-status response containing the result for each external user deletion request.

404.description:
Returns an error if the listed external users are not found, or the authenticated
user does not have the right permissions to delete external users.

Archive.description:
An archive is a folder dedicated to storing content that is
redundant, outdated, or trivial. Content in an archive is not accessible to its
owner and collaborators.
To use this feature, you must request GCM scope for your Box application.

id.description: The unique identifier that represents an archive.

name.description:
The name of the archive.

The following restrictions to the archive name apply: names containing
non-printable ASCII characters, forward and backward slashes
(`/`, `\`), names with trailing spaces, and names `.` and `..` are
not allowed.

size.description: The size of the archive in bytes.

description.example: This is an archive for important documents.

owned_by.description: The part of an archive API response that describes the user who owns the archive.

id.description: The unique identifier that represents a user who owns the archive.

Archive.title: Archive

entries.description: A list in which each entry represents an archive object.

allOf.description:
The part of an API response that describes marker
based pagination.

limit.description:
The limit that was used for these entries. This will be the same as the
`limit` query parameter unless that value exceeded the maximum value
allowed. The maximum value varies by API.

next_marker.description: The marker for the start of the next page of results.

status.description: The HTTP status of the response.

message.description: A short message describing the error.

context_info.description:
A free-form object that contains additional context
about the error. The possible fields are defined on
a per-endpoint basis. `message` is only one example.

help_url.description: A URL that links to more information about why this error occurred.

request_id.description:
A unique identifier for this response, which can be used
when contacting Box support.

is_co_owner_role_enabled.description: The co-owner role is enabled for collaboration.

is_editor_role_enabled.description: The editor role is enabled for collaboration.

is_previewer_role_enabled.description: The previewer role is enabled for collaboration.

is_previewer_uploader_role_enabled.description: The previewer uploader role is enabled for collaboration.

is_uploader_role_enabled.description: The uploader role is enabled for collaboration.

is_viewer_role_enabled.description: The viewer role is enabled for collaboration.

is_viewer_uploader_role_enabled.description: The viewer uploader role is enabled for collaboration.

CustomSessionDurationGroupItem.description: A custom session duration group item.

id.description: Group ID (numerical).

CustomSessionDurationGroupItem.title: Custom session duration group item

The selected option for the access level of shared links.

Disables custom shared link URLs for public access.
Hides the custom domain in shared links.

Disables users to invite collaborators using invite links.
Disables users to invite group collaborators.

Possible values: `enable_external_collaboration`, `limit_collaboration_to_allowlisted_domains`, `limit_collaboration_to_users_within_enterprise`.
The external collaboration allowlist users.
Enables watermarking enterprise feature.
Only admins can create and delete first-level folders, files, and bookmarks.
Only selected users can create tags.

Enables email uploads.
Enables custom settings.
Require uploaders to log in with a Box account for Forms.
Company brand color and logo defaults to Logo for use on Brand Color for Forms.

Indicates if editors are allowed for file requests feature.

Enables shared links expiration.
The expiration time for shared links.
Enables public shared links expiration.
The expiration time for public shared links.

Enables shared links expiration notification.
The number of days before expiration to notify users.

Enables auto delete.
The number of days before auto delete.
Prevents users from modifying auto delete expiration.

Enables collaboration expiration.

allOf.description: Determines if users are allowed to sign up on their own.

Depends on `is_managed_user_signup_corporate_email_enabled`. A true value represents `In daily summary emails`. A false value represents `Immediately`.
When enabled, prevents users from changing their primary email address.
Determines if multi-factor authentication is required for all managed users.
When enabled, prevents common words / email address to be used in a password.
Enables exposed password detection.

value.description: When an enterprise password reset was last applied.

allOf.description: When enabled, admins are notified when users request a forget password email.
When enabled, admins are notified when users change passwords in Settings.
Requires strong passwords for External Collaborators.
Disables users from being migrated in or out of the enterprise.

Number of failed login attempts before the primary admin is notified.
Minimum number of characters required for passwords.

Minimum number of numbers required in passwords.
Minimum number of symbols required in passwords.
Determines if users must reset their passwords every specified time period.
Number of previous passwords users are prevented from using.

allowlist_domains.description: List of domains that are allowed for external collaboration. Applies if state is `allowlist`.

state.description: The state of the external collaboration security settings. Possible values include `enabled`, `disabled`, `allowlist`, and `denylist`.

scheduled_status.description: The status of the scheduling to apply external collaboration security settings. Possible values include `in_progress`, `scheduled`, `completed`, `failed`, and `scheduled_immediate`.

factor_type_settings.description: Factor type for the external collaborators authentication. Possible values include `totp`, `any`, or `unknown`.

Hub.description:
A standard representation of a Box Hub, as returned from any
Box Hubs API endpoints by default.

title.description: The title given to the Box Hub.

description.description: The description of the Box Hub. First 200 characters are returned.
description.example: All the contracts for the company.

created_at.description:
The date and time when the folder was created. This value may
be `null` for some folders such as the root folder or the trash
folder.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the Box Hub was last updated.

allOf.description: The user who created this Box Hub.
The user who last modified this Box Hub.

view_count.description: The number of views for the Box Hub.

is_ai_enabled.description: Indicates if AI features are enabled for the Box Hub.

is_collaboration_restricted_to_enterpris.description: Indicates if collaboration is restricted to the enterprise.

can_non_owners_invite.description: Indicates if non-owners can invite others to the Box Hub.

can_shared_link_be_created.description: Indicates if a shared link can be created for the Box Hub.

Hub.title: Box Hub

Hub--Base.description: The bare basic representation of a Box Hub.

id.description:
The unique identifier that represent a Box Hub.

The ID for any Box Hub can be determined
by visiting a Box Hub in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the URL `https://*.app.box.com/hubs/123`
the `hub_id` is `123`.

Hub--Base.title: Box Hub (Base)

HubAccessGrantee.description: The user or group that is granted access.
HubAccessGrantee.title: Box Hub Accessible By

HubCollaboration.description:
A Box Hub collaboration object grants a user or group access 
to a Box Hub with permissions defined by a specific role.

id.description: The unique identifier for this collaboration.

role.description:
The level of access granted to a Box Hub.
Possible values are `editor`, `viewer`, and `co-owner`.

status.description:
The status of the collaboration invitation. If the status
is `pending`, `login` and `name` return an empty string.

is_accepted.description:
Whether or not the terms of service have been accepted.  The
field is `null` when there is no terms of service required.

allOf.description:
The terms of service that must be accepted before the
collaboration can be accepted. The field is `null` when
there is no terms of service required.

enterprise_has_strong_password_required_.description:
Whether or not the enterprise that owns the content requires
a strong password to collaborate on the content, or enforces
an exposed password detection for the external collaborators.

user_has_strong_password.description:
Whether or not the user has a strong and not exposed password set
for their account. The field is `null` when a strong password is
not required.

enterprise_has_two_factor_auth_enabled.description:
Whether or not the enterprise that owns the content requires
two-factor authentication to be enabled in order to
collaborate on the content.

user_has_two_factor_authentication_enabl.description:
Whether or not the user has two-factor authentication
enabled. The field is `null` when two-factor
authentication is not required.

The ID of the user or group.

Alternatively, use `login` to specify a user by email
address.

The email address of the user who gets access to the item.

Alternatively, use `id` to specify a user by user ID.
